relation: Get involved and make plenty of friends and when you need help with a class or something just ask.
I believe the experience that I am having at JU is phenomenal. The class sizes are great for struggling students and the staff are extremely helpful.
pageTitle: Jacksonville University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {161563=Jacksonville University has screwed up my financial aid and tuition. They told me to take an independent study when I really did not had to take one and now I owe them $1000., 79697=The internet gets really slow at the end of the night when everyone's homework is due at 11:59 pm and you would think that so much money could pay for a better internet connection, but that's as much trouble as you'll find., 171003=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here The school isn't THAT small. There's always something to do there. It's a small community and you will get to know more people then if you were at a bigger college. Joining clubs will keep you busy as well if that's what you're looking for. Am learning a lot The fact that the class size is really small, gives the teacher more time to give out more information and pretty much call out each and every one of us to make sure we know whats going on. Sometimes you think you understand until you're asked; that's when you challenge yourself and find if you understand the material at hand. The subject doesn't matter. The professors there will learn your name and know your capacity pretty soon. If you need help. Help is everywhere! tutoring programs by subject are free. Login to rate or flag the reviews Erick from Coral Springs, FL 07/20/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 9 out of 11 people found this review useful. 2 of 42
